p: HepG2 (liver hepatocellular cells) and MCF-7 cells (human breast adenocarcinoma cell line) were cultured in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO 2 in air at 37 °C, in RPMI1640 medium containing 10% ( v/ v) fetal calf serum, 2 mM glutamine, and antibiotics (200 U of penicillin and 50 mg of streptomycin per liter) and were maintained at 37 °C in a humidified 5% CO 2 atmosphere [ 41]. Cytotoxicity was measured using the MTT test with slight modifications. Cells were seeded at 5 × 10 3 cells/well in 200 μL of growth medium and were incubated at 37 °C for 24 h for cell adherence. The microplates were treated with the substances and incubated for 24, 48, and 72 h.
